meanings.definition: To make a strong impression on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The magician's trick did not asar the audience.
meanings.sent2: Her kindness will asar everyone she meets.

meanings.definition: To be or become visible or noticeable.
meanings.sent1: The stars asar brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: His talent began to asar after years of practice.

meanings.sent4: The truth will always asar, no matter how well it is hidden.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays asar through the clouds, bringing warmth to the land.

meanings.definition: To be or become effective or successful.
meanings.sent1: The new marketing strategy did not asar as expected.
